metadata.titel_preek: The Love Olympics Go to Jerusalem

kernfrasen: Jesus turns his back on his glory and begins his descent
highly paid fixture on the lecture circuit
participating in suffering that she could not relieve

cognitieve_implicaties: Love is a performance that requires constant effort and 'winning'.
theologische_implicaties: Human love is finite and prone to exhaustion.
ethische_implicaties: Pressure to perform romantically leads to burnout or replacement of partners.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Trivialization of the sacrificial nature of the Cross if not carefully contrasted.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Re-activates the source domain of the Olympics to mock the exhaustion of modern romance.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Fixed downward toward the sanitation workers

cognitieve_implicaties: God's presence is found by looking down, not up.
theologische_implicaties: The Transfiguration is only meaningful in light of the Crucifixion.
onbedoelde_consequenties: May imply God is absent from 'high' or joyful experiences.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Uses the concrete imagery of King in Memphis and the preacher's own accident to revitalize the concept of 'humility'.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses a consistent spatial metaphor (UP is GLORY/ROMANCE, DOWN is REAL LOVE/SUFFERING) to bridge the Transfiguration and the 1 Corinthians text.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Irony: The 'Olympics' (effort/competition) are relocated to 'Jerusalem' (sacrifice), redefining the 'winner' as the one who dies.

sterktes.beschrijving: Takes the 'dead' metaphor of 1 Corinthians 13 (often used at weddings) and re-contextualizes it through the 'Love Olympics' and the 'Pavement'.
sterktes.voorbeeld: Love does not even require reciprocity; love goes to Memphis, love gets down on the pavement.

risicos.beschrijving: By focusing heavily on 'presence' and 'embrace' in suffering, the juridical/substitutionary aspects of the Cross are minimized.
risicos.voorbeeld: She was holding and participating in suffering... her silent presence was relieving it.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view God as a co-sufferer but not necessarily a Savior from sin.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The Mount of Transfiguration (The High Place)
sub_worlds: The New York Times Styles Section (The Superficial World)
The Pavement in NYC (The World of Vulnerability)
The Hospital Room (The World of Terminal Illness)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: Extremely effective in grounding the abstract 'descent' in physical pain.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Reinforces the 'God with us' schema through the imagery of the grandmother in the bed.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Contrasts the 'Valentine' schema with the 'Jerusalem' schema.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligns with the transition from Epiphany (Light/Mountain) to Lent (Shadow/Valley).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in spatial mapping. It successfully moves the hearer from a 'Horizontal' view of love (transactions/romance) to a 'Vertical' view (descent/incarnation). The dominant landscape is one of movement: the downward trajectory of Christ.

revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Link it to the 'stink' of the sanitation workers or the 'asphalt' of the street.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Love is the smell of a garbage truck in Memphis.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from 'Love Olympics' (competition) to 'Love Child' (Madonna) is slightly cluttered.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Focus more on the 'transactional' nature of the Madonna example to align with the Frank Rich quote.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: God is powerless to stop the cancer, only able to hug the sufferer.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Resurrection' power mentioned in the Transfiguration section.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To build on the 'booths' Peter wants to build.
alternatieve_domeinen.doel_concept: The Church as a temporary shelter vs. a permanent fortress.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A profound use of CMT to deconstruct cultural sentimentality and reconstruct a robust, incarnational theology of the Cross.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'Love Olympics' as a clever hook, CMT reveals it as a vital cognitive tool to disrupt the 'Love as Transaction' schema.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on learning styles, CMT shows how the preacher uses the 'Path' image-schema to physically move the listener's mind from the mountain to the valley.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's power lies in the 'Downward' mapping, which forces a re-evaluation of 'High' status as actually being 'Far' from God.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Valley of the shadow of death
appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'UP-DOWN' orientational metaphor.
